txt.en: 'I have heard reports of White Hand Uruks all over the Great Delving, but did not believe any had pressed this deep. I have seen them, taking hold of the halls to the west, and I fear what their purpose might be. I suspected their plan would be to enlist some of the goblin tribes to supplement their forces, but now I fear something more sinister.\n\n'The ones I am particularly concerned with are the White Hand taskmasters. They seem to carry considerable influence among the Orcs of Khazad-dûm. I would ask you to defeat as many of them as you can... perhaps it will dishearten the others.'

'So most of their number has fallen... that is good. I dare say they will have a difficult time at recruiting any goblins without them.\n\n'Until the White Hand has been driven from the halls, I will not be satisifed... but you have done your part, [placeholder].'
'If the White Hand takes over Khazad-dûm, or allies with the forces here, then we will be but the first casualties of this war.'
The dwarves at Jazârgund are concerned about the presence of White Hand Uruks this deep into Moria.

White Hand taskmasters can be found in Fehem-dûm and Hadâd-dûm, east of Jazârgund.\n\nBorgar fears the White Hand Uruks are wresting control of the Orcs and goblins of Moria. He wants to thin their ranks.
Borgar is at Jazârgund, west of Hadâd-dûm and Fehem-dûm.\n\nBorgar will be pleased to know that the White Hand Uruks' numbers have been greatly reduced.
